meanings.definition: To grant an option on (a stock, bond, or commodity).
meanings.sent1: She optioned the stock for future purchase.
meanings.sent2: He optioned the bond as part of his investment strategy.
meanings.sent3: The investor optioned the commodity and waited for the right time to buy.
meanings.sent4: The market optioned the stock, causing a surge in trading.
meanings.sent5: Optioning the bond allowed her to secure a good deal later on.

meanings.definition: To acquire an option on (a player) for a specified amount.
meanings.sent1: The team optioned the player for the upcoming season.
meanings.sent2: He optioned the star player for a high price.
meanings.sent3: The coach optioned the rookie and hoped for a successful season.
meanings.sent4: Acquiring the player optioned a chance for victory.
meanings.sent5: Optioning the player was a strategic move by the team management.

meanings.definition: To grant an option on (a book) for publication.
meanings.sent1: The publishing house optioned the book for release next year.
meanings.sent2: She optioned the novel to a renowned publisher.
meanings.sent3: The author optioned the book and eagerly awaited its publication.
meanings.sent4: Optioning the book opened doors to a wider audience.
meanings.sent5: The book being optioned for publication was a dream come true for the writer.
